newsitem.title: USA: Oregon abortion clinic damaged by fire.
newsitem.headline: Oregon abortion clinic damaged by fire.

text.p: An early-morning fire of suspicious origin caused heavy damage Friday to a busy Portland abortion clinic that has been the target of arsonists in the past.

Officials with the Portland Fire Bureau said the cause of the fire was "suspicious." FBI agents and officials from the federal Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco and Firearms are investigating and "pursuing all leads," an FBI spokesman said.

Fire broke out shortly before 3 a.m. (6 a.m. EDT) at the Lovejoy Surgicenter in the northwest part of the city, and flames were shooting out a back window when firefighters arrived, Dave Centres of the Portland Fire Bureau said.

About 70 firefighters responded to the scene and extinguished the fire within an hour, but the two-story concrete block building was damaged heavily, Portland fire officials said. The building was unoccupied at the time and there were no injuries.
Employees told the Oregonian newspaper that bomb threats had been called in last weekend to the clinic and several other facilities in Oregon and Washington.

The abortion clinic, one of the nation's busiest, has been the frequent site of demonstrations and has been victimised twice before by arson fires. The clinic was the subject of a 1996 book, "Lovejoy: A Year in the Life of an Abortion Clinic."
